summary: This document is an email chain from July 24, 2020, regarding media inquiries about naming alleged victims in the Epstein case. An unidentified journalist asks a U.S. Department of Justice spokesperson about legal barriers to naming victims, noting some have waived anonymity. The spokesperson declines to comment and directs inquiries to the press office.

persons.name: Spokesman
persons.role: Spokesperson for the U.S. Department of Justice
persons.context: The spokesperson for the U.S. Department of Justice responds to a media inquiry, stating that prosecutors are not available for comment and directing further questions to the press office.

events.title: Media Inquiry About Naming Epstein Victims
events.description: An unidentified journalist emails the U.S. Department of Justice asking about legal barriers to naming alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein, noting that some victims are adults and have previously waived anonymity.

keyFacts: A media inquiry was made on July 24, 2020, regarding the naming of alleged victims in the Epstein case.
The inquiry notes that at least two alleged victims are adults and have previously waived anonymity to speak out as survivors.
The U.S. Department of Justice spokesperson declined to comment and directed further inquiries to the press office.
The document reflects ongoing public and media interest in victim identification issues years after Epstein's death.
